concept.title: oxy_url() Function
concept.shortdesc: This function extends the standard CSS url() function by allowing you to specify additional relative path components (parameters loc_1 to loc_n).

conbody.p: uses all these parameters to construct an absolute location. Note that any of the parameters that are passed to the function can be either relative or absolute locations. These locations can be expressed as String objects, functions, or editor variables (built-in or custom).

dlentry.dd: String representing the base location. If not absolute, will be solved relative to the CSS file URL.
Strings representing relative location path components.

conbody.p: The following function receives String objects as input parameters:oxy_url('http://www.oxygenxml.com/css/test.css', '../dir1/', 'dir2/dir3/', '../../dir4/dir5/test.xml')and returns:'http://www.oxygenxml.com/dir1/dir4/dir5/test.xml'
